DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , post-market , single arm , multicenter study compare Baseline data 12 month 36 month data 136 female patient Stress Urinary Incontinence
DOC.brief_title: The European Study Altis Single Incision Sling System Female Stress Urinary Incontinence
DOC.criteria: The subject female least 18 year age The subject use method contraception consider effective investigator childbearing potential The subject able willing complete procedure followup visit indicate protocol . The subject confirm stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) cough stress test baseline . The subject fail first line treatment ( noninvasive therapy , eg . behavioral modification , Pelvic Floor/Kegel exercise , biofeedback ) good compliance treatment The subject prior surgical SUI treatment ( include bulk agent ) . The subject concomitant Pelvic Organ Prolapse repair hysterectomy Altis procedure . The subject incontinence due neurogenic cause ( e.g . multiple sclerosis , spinal cord/brain injury , cerebrovascular accident , detrusorexternal sphincter dyssynergia , Parkinson 's disease , similar condition ) . The subject predominant uncontrolled primary urge incontinence accord investigator judgment The patient detrusor overactivity determine urodynamics The subject intrinsic sphincter deficiency define urodynamically Maximal Urethral Closure Pressure < 20 cm H2O and/or Valsalva Leak Point Pressure < 60 cm H2O The subject atonic bladder , persistent post void residual ( PVR ) > 100 ml chronic urinary retention . The subject untreated urinary malignancy The subject undergone radiation brachy therapy chemotherapy treat pelvic cancer . The subject urethrovaginal fistula urethral diverticulum congenital urinary anomaly The subject serious bleed disorder require anticoagulant therapy The subject pregnant and/or plan get pregnant future . The subject Body Mass Index â‰¥ 35 ( obese class II ) . The subject contraindication surgical procedure accord Altis SIS System IFU . The subject active urogenital infection active skin infection region surgery mainly time implantation . The subject enrol concomitant clinical trial .
